ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The professor of this course was terribly disorganized and was regularly rude to the students. He frequently arrived in class late, and expected students to stay after the class had officially ended. His assignments were given on an ad hoc basis, and he did not provide some students with the main component of the course, the internship with a mission at the United Nations.

This class was very intersting to take because it is divided in two sections: a theory part and a practice one. Although the theory part could be better structured, the practice gives you the opportunity to do a voluntary internship at New York's UN Headquarteres and to know form first-hand how the system works.
The trips to New York were very helpful. I loved this class, thanks so much for offering it!
the insider perspective we get about the UN process from prof.lee. the politics that are associated with it and the innovative ways we should think about when solving problems.
The internship opportunity and the funding to support the transporation to/from NYC. The professor is also helpful with linking students with organizations and people related to their interests.
Internship at the UN
the interactive learning and ability to attend meetings at the UN
My UN internship at a UN Mission

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: organization- weekly classes can be more coherent, students can hopefully get advance notice for presentations.

The professor's organization. He assigned students presentations at random and on short notice without regard for other assignments they might have. While it is his prerogative to assign presentations, they did not seem to be a part of a cohesive plan. Also there were some students who presented multiple times and others who literally did not even participate in discussion until the second month. Also the lecture lasted an hour and a half but that amount of time wasn't necessary. There was rarely looking to the readings that were assigned and true discussion, rather the professor discussing various somewhat related themes.
Better coordination assigning presentations

how class work relates to current issues at the UN. We spent the entire semester on climate change, but the UN is completely focused on sustainable development. I wished we covered that topic, it would have greatly approved my internship experience.
Better planning and coordinationStronger content coverageMore access to internship opportunities
More classes focused on international diplomacy.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The TA was available, but was ill-informed due to the fact that the curriculum and agenda for the following weeks course could be changed on a whim.
availability and quality of help from prof. lee were great.
Very good
Both qere very hepful and willing to cooperate in every single way they could.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: As a biologist,t his course has helped me to broaden my knowledge on international governance and negotiations processes.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: In order to learn by interning with a mission at the United Nations.
I wanted to learn more about how the UN works.
Because I wanted the opportunity to experience the happenings at the UN and various countries means of addressing environmental concerns at an international level
Because I really wanted to take a class related to international diplomacy and because Prof. Lee's class is very well-known within the UN system.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: No, the course did not, as explained in Question 11 response.
The class fully lived up to my expectations.
In a sense, yes. I learned about the various UNFCCC initiatives and policies in place.
Yes
No
Yes, however I woul have liked more classes from the professor and less presentations from students.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: No, I was not offered an internship with a UN mission.
Yes
No
I would have liked to learn a little bit more about the theoretical part.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Great team work.
Working in group always helps to exchange ideas and make more rich a presentation.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: My advice would certainly be to avoid the course, unless they were so motivated to gain access to the United Nations that the academic integrity of the coursework did not matter.
Get in touch with your Mission immediately, since this is an invaluable experience.
The lectures are painful but if you are lucky you'll get an internship with a great mission and it will be worth it.
Go as many times you can to the UN. That was the best

Very little learning from the class room sessions. The value of this course hinges heavily on being placed with a mission at the UN. However, there is also a possibility of not finding an internship.Take this course knowing fully well that an internship may not come through. The class room sessions are less than valuable
Read the readings, don't be aradi to ask, and start working on your internships as soon as you know you want to take the class.
